comments.body: It's a shame that if any files are in JSON format then any extra useful information won't get propagated. But for this I think this is fine.

Yeah, in order for this to be general, we can't assume that logs will be in JSON. And this model of collecting logs is most useful for older applications that can't be modified to write to stdout, and I'd expect fewer older applications to write JSON logs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@<source>
  type tail
  format none
  time_key time
  path ${filepath}
